section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਗ੍ਰਿਹੁ ਤਜਿ ਬਨ ਖੰਡ ਜਾਈਐ ਚੁਨਿ ਖਾਈਐ ਕੰਦਾ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Abandoning his household, he may go to the forest, and live by eating roots;

transliteration.text: grih taj ban khand jāīai chun khāīai kandā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਅਜਹੁ ਬਿਕਾਰ ਨ ਛੋਡਈ ਪਾਪੀ ਮਨੁ ਮੰਦਾ ॥੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: but even so, his sinful, evil mind does not renounce corruption. ||1||

transliteration.text: ajah bikār n shōdaī pāpī man mandā .1.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਕਿਉ ਛੂਟਉ ਕੈਸੇ ਤਰਉ ਭਵਜਲ ਨਿਧਿ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: How can anyone be saved? How can anyone cross over the terrifying world-ocean?

transliteration.text: kiu shūtau kaisē tarau bhavajal nidh bhārī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਰਾਖੁ ਰਾਖੁ ਮੇਰੇ ਬੀਠੁਲਾ ਜਨੁ ਸਰਨਿ ਤੁਮ੍ਹਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Save me, save me, O my Lord! Your humble servant seeks Your Sanctuary. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: rākh rākh mērē bīthulā jan saran tumhārī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਬਿਖੈ ਬਿਖੈ ਕੀ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਤਜੀਅ ਨਹ ਜਾਈ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I cannot escape my desire for sin and corruption.

transliteration.text: bikhai bikhai kī bāsanā tajī nah jāī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਅਨਿਕ ਜਤਨ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਖੀਐ ਫਿਰਿ ਫਿਰਿ ਲਪਟਾਈ ॥੨॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I make all sorts of efforts to hold back from this desire, but it clings to me, again and again. ||2||

transliteration.text: anik jatan kar rākhīai phir phir lapatāī .2.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਜਰਾ ਜੀਵਨ ਜੋਬਨੁ ਗਇਆ ਕਿਛੁ ਕੀਆ ਨ ਨੀਕਾ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Youth and old age - my entire life has passed, but I haven't done any good.

transliteration.text: jarā jīvan jōban gaiā kish kīā n nīkā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਇਹੁ ਜੀਅਰਾ ਨਿਰਮੋਲਕੋ ਕਉਡੀ ਲਗਿ ਮੀਕਾ ॥੩॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This priceless soul has been treated as if if were worth no more than a shell. ||3||

transliteration.text: ih jīarā niramōlakō kaudī lag mīkā .3.

text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਮੇਰੇ ਮਾਧਵਾ ਤੂ ਸਰਬ ਬਿਆਪੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, O my Lord, You are contained in all.

transliteration.text: kah kabīr mērē mādhavā tū sarab biāpī .

text: ਤੁਮ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਨਾਹੀ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਮੋਹਿ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਪਾਪੀ ॥੪॥੩॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: There is none as merciful as You are, and none as sinful as I am. ||4||3||

transliteration.text: tum samasar nāhī daiāl mōh samasar pāpī .4.3.
